Description: One pendant and 7 beads of different shapes and materials. A: One pendant in the shape of a poppy-seed, the top is broken off just at the height of the perforation. Made of slightly translucent carnelian. B: One elongated sphere bead made of light turquoise faience. C: Three disc-shaped beads, two made of ostrich eggshell, one made of vivid turquoise faience. D: Half a spherical bead made of a green glass, one air pocket in the outer surface. E: Two segmented cylindrical beads, one is made of green faience, 2 segments preserved, the other with faint traces of green glaze with 5 segments preserved.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D16.U and P, level 1, mound β
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
